title: 'Finally! A boy!': Putin has two sons with gymnast Alina Kabaeva, claims report
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has two sons with gymnast Alina Kabaeva, Ivan and Vladimir Jr., aged 9 and 5. The boys live in isolation, traveling on yachts and jets, taught by South African governesses within palaces. Their existence had been kept secret until now revealed by Dossier Centre. Ivan is Putin's first son after three daughters -- Maria 39, Katerina 37 and Luiza 21.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin has two sons with gymnast Alina Kabaeva, Ivan and Vladimir Jr., aged 9 and 5. The boys live in isolation, traveling on yachts and jets, taught by South African governesses within palaces. Their existence had been kept secret until now revealed by Dossier Centre. Ivan is Putin's first son after three daughters -- Maria 39, Katerina 37 and Luiza 21.

title: Did Tiger Woods accuse Kamala Harris of having a ‘fake accent’? Here’s the truth…
content: The viral post has garnered over 5 million views and 173,000 likes. However, the quote was fake, and something Woods never said. The account describes itself as the "golf version" of The Onion and The Babylon Bee, which are popular parody and fake news websites known for their humorous content.
summary: The viral post has garnered over 5 million views and 173,000 likes. However, the quote was fake, and something Woods never said. The account describes itself as the "golf version" of The Onion and The Babylon Bee, which are popular parody and fake news websites known for their humorous content.

title: Alabama man dies after Florida surgeon mistakenly removes liver instead of spleen
content: William Bryan, a 70-year-old from Alabama, tragically died during surgery in Florida after a surgeon mistakenly removed his liver instead of his spleen. This grave error caused immediate and catastrophic blood loss. His widow is now pursuing both civil and criminal proceedings against the surgeon and hospital involved in the incident.
summary: William Bryan, a 70-year-old from Alabama, tragically died during surgery in Florida after a surgeon mistakenly removed his liver instead of his spleen. This grave error caused immediate and catastrophic blood loss. His widow is now pursuing both civil and criminal proceedings against the surgeon and hospital involved in the incident.

title: Why Elon Musk's Grok-2 AI images is raising serious concerns
content: The controversy surrounding Grok AI intensified when it began generating images that included depictions of well-known figures like Donald Trump and Kamala Harris in unexpected and inappropriate contexts. Unlike other companies like Google and OpenAI, which have implemented strict policies to prevent their AI tools from creating images of specific, recognizable people, xAI has taken a different approach. Musk, who promotes a philosophy of minimal censorship and maximal free speech, has allowed Grok-2 to operate with fewer restrictions.
summary: The controversy surrounding Grok AI intensified when it began generating images that included depictions of well-known figures like Donald Trump and Kamala Harris in unexpected and inappropriate contexts. Unlike other companies like Google and OpenAI, which have implemented strict policies to prevent their AI tools from creating images of specific, recognizable people, xAI has taken a different approach. Musk, who promotes a philosophy of minimal censorship and maximal free speech, has allowed Grok-2 to operate with fewer restrictions.

title: 'I am deeply sorry': UK PM Keir Starmer after report on Grenfell Tower fire incident
content: UK PM Keir Starmer issued an apology to Grenfell Tower fire victims following a report attributing the tragedy to government and industry failings. The 2017 blaze, which claimed 72 lives, was exacerbated by flammable cladding. Survivors call for justice as investigations focus on multiple individuals and organisations. In its final 1,700-page report, the inquiry laid most of the responsibility on the companies involved in the building's maintenance and refurbishment.
summary: UK PM Keir Starmer issued an apology to Grenfell Tower fire victims following a report attributing the tragedy to government and industry failings. The 2017 blaze, which claimed 72 lives, was exacerbated by flammable cladding. Survivors call for justice as investigations focus on multiple individuals and organisations. In its final 1,700-page report, the inquiry laid most of the responsibility on the companies involved in the building's maintenance and refurbishment.

title: 'This guy actually brought his kids around Jeffrey Epstein': Donald Trump's old photo viral
content: ​But did Donald Trump ever take his kids to Epstein? According to reports, Donald brought his son Eric who was then 11 years old onto a flight with Epstein and his girlfriend Ghislaine Maxwell. The Trumps flew with Epstein and Maxwell aboard a Grumman Gulfstream II private jet from Palm Beach, Florida, to Teterboro Airport in New Jersey on August 13, 1995, the flight logs showed, a Business Insider report said.
summary: ​But did Donald Trump ever take his kids to Epstein? According to reports, Donald brought his son Eric who was then 11 years old onto a flight with Epstein and his girlfriend Ghislaine Maxwell. The Trumps flew with Epstein and Maxwell aboard a Grumman Gulfstream II private jet from Palm Beach, Florida, to Teterboro Airport in New Jersey on August 13, 1995, the flight logs showed, a Business Insider report said.

title: Will King Charles abdicate? Here's what Queen Camilla said on his health
content: ​A Royal insider said it would be the "best decision" for the King to step down now. “No one expects his [King Charles] reign to last much longer, especially because his health could take a dramatic turn for the worse at any time,” the insider was by In Touch. “Stepping down now would be the best decision for the monarchy,” the insider added.
summary: ​A Royal insider said it would be the "best decision" for the King to step down now. “No one expects his [King Charles] reign to last much longer, especially because his health could take a dramatic turn for the worse at any time,” the insider was by In Touch. “Stepping down now would be the best decision for the monarchy,” the insider added.

title: 2017 Grenfell Tower fire in London that claimed 72 lives due to UK govt failure: Inquiry
content: The 2017 Grenfell Tower fire in London that claimed 72 lives has been attributed to failings by the government, construction industry, and companies involved in fitting flammable cladding. A public inquiry criticized authorities and firms for dishonestly marketing combustible cladding as safe. The blaze spread due to cladding added during a 2016 refurbishment.
summary: The 2017 Grenfell Tower fire in London that claimed 72 lives has been attributed to failings by the government, construction industry, and companies involved in fitting flammable cladding. A public inquiry criticized authorities and firms for dishonestly marketing combustible cladding as safe. The blaze spread due to cladding added during a 2016 refurbishment.

title: Beware of 'beautiful' foreign spies, China warns students
content: China's state security agency has issued a warning to students with access to sensitive information about foreign spies employing 'romance traps' to obtain confidential data. According to the ministry of state security, these spies disguise themselves as attractive individuals and target young students. Citizens are advised to stay alert against such infiltration methods.
summary: China's state security agency has issued a warning to students with access to sensitive information about foreign spies employing 'romance traps' to obtain confidential data. According to the ministry of state security, these spies disguise themselves as attractive individuals and target young students. Citizens are advised to stay alert against such infiltration methods.

title: US envoy to Taiwan declares ties 'rock solid' amid military threats from China
content: The top US envoy to Taiwan underscored America's unwavering support for the island, emphasizing substantial military aid and equipment transfers to bolster its defense against China. This statement comes during heightened global tensions and follows recent high-level discussions between US and Chinese officials on maintaining cross-Strait peace and stability.
summary: The top US envoy to Taiwan underscored America's unwavering support for the island, emphasizing substantial military aid and equipment transfers to bolster its defense against China. This statement comes during heightened global tensions and follows recent high-level discussions between US and Chinese officials on maintaining cross-Strait peace and stability.

title: Japanese island eradicates rabbit-killing mongoose
content: Japan has wiped out all mongooses on a subtropical island, officials said, after the animals ignored the venomous snakes they were brought in to hunt and preyed on endangered local rabbits instead. "It is said that the mongooses, which are active during the day, rarely came into contact with the nocturnal habu snakes," a local official told AFP. The rabbits only live on Amami Oshima and one other island and are listed as endangered on the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) red list.
summary: Japan has wiped out all mongooses on a subtropical island, officials said, after the animals ignored the venomous snakes they were brought in to hunt and preyed on endangered local rabbits instead. "It is said that the mongooses, which are active during the day, rarely came into contact with the nocturnal habu snakes," a local official told AFP. The rabbits only live on Amami Oshima and one other island and are listed as endangered on the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) red list.

title: Boko Haram militants on motorcycles attacked a Nigerian village, killing over 100, residents say
content: In northeastern Nigeria's Yobe state, suspected Boko Haram extremists killed at least 100 villagers, targeting a market and homes. Conflicting death tolls have been reported, with community leaders confirming 102 deaths. President Tinubu condemned the attack but did not introduce new security measures to address the persistent violence.
summary: In northeastern Nigeria's Yobe state, suspected Boko Haram extremists killed at least 100 villagers, targeting a market and homes. Conflicting death tolls have been reported, with community leaders confirming 102 deaths. President Tinubu condemned the attack but did not introduce new security measures to address the persistent violence.

title: Ukrainian foreign minister Dmytro Kuleba resigns amid expected major reshuffle
content: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has resigned ahead of a major government reshuffle following Russian strikes in Lviv. President Zelenskyy aims to strengthen the government before his visit to the United States. Several other ministers have also stepped down, signaling significant changes in Ukraine's political landscape. ​Kuleba, however, has not given any reason why he chose to step down from his role as foreign minister.
summary: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has resigned ahead of a major government reshuffle following Russian strikes in Lviv. President Zelenskyy aims to strengthen the government before his visit to the United States. Several other ministers have also stepped down, signaling significant changes in Ukraine's political landscape. ​Kuleba, however, has not given any reason why he chose to step down from his role as foreign minister.

title: Workers see dramatic fall in share of global income: UN
content: The UN's International Labour Organization states that the global labour income share has fallen by 1.6% since 2004, causing a $2.4 trillion annual shortfall for workers. This decline, intensified by the Covid-19 pandemic, highlights rising inequality and underscores the need for policies to ensure fair economic distribution.
summary: The UN's International Labour Organization states that the global labour income share has fallen by 1.6% since 2004, causing a $2.4 trillion annual shortfall for workers. This decline, intensified by the Covid-19 pandemic, highlights rising inequality and underscores the need for policies to ensure fair economic distribution.

title: Ship scheduled for world cruise in May has been stranded in Belfast for past three months
content: About 200 passengers are stranded in Belfast, awaiting the departure of the Villa Vie Residences' Odyssey for a three-year world cruise. The ship, built in 1993 and offline since 2020, needs repairs to its rudder shafts, steelwork, and engine. Passengers can spend their days on board but must leave each evening.
summary: About 200 passengers are stranded in Belfast, awaiting the departure of the Villa Vie Residences' Odyssey for a three-year world cruise. The ship, built in 1993 and offline since 2020, needs repairs to its rudder shafts, steelwork, and engine. Passengers can spend their days on board but must leave each evening.

title: 'Will release UFO footage, Jeffrey Epstein's documents if elected': Trump claims
content: Donald Trump has pledged to release UFO footage and Jeffrey Epstein's documents if he wins the presidential election. He also intends to form a commission on John F. Kennedy's assassination and make related documents public early in his term. Trump clarified he had no involvement with Epstein despite their acquaintance.
summary: Donald Trump has pledged to release UFO footage and Jeffrey Epstein's documents if he wins the presidential election. He also intends to form a commission on John F. Kennedy's assassination and make related documents public early in his term. Trump clarified he had no involvement with Epstein despite their acquaintance.

title: Iran summons Australian ambassador over Instagram post supporting LGBTQIA+ rights
content: Iran summoned Australia's ambassador following an Instagram post by the Australian embassy in Tehran celebrating 'Wear It Purple Day' for LGBTQIA+ youth. Iran criticized the post as promoting homosexuality and contrary to Islamic traditions, while Australia defended its stance on human rights. The post is still available on the embassy's Instagram page.
summary: Iran summoned Australia's ambassador following an Instagram post by the Australian embassy in Tehran celebrating 'Wear It Purple Day' for LGBTQIA+ youth. Iran criticized the post as promoting homosexuality and contrary to Islamic traditions, while Australia defended its stance on human rights. The post is still available on the embassy's Instagram page.

title: 'Do not neglect us': Hamas releases video of slain Israeli hostage calling for help
content: Hamas released a video showing Ori Danino, one of six hostages found executed in Rafah. In the video, Danino describes harsh living conditions and criticizes Israeli leadership for failed rescue attempts. He urges Israelis to continue efforts to save the hostages and ends with a plea, "People of Israel: Do not neglect us."
summary: Hamas released a video showing Ori Danino, one of six hostages found executed in Rafah. In the video, Danino describes harsh living conditions and criticizes Israeli leadership for failed rescue attempts. He urges Israelis to continue efforts to save the hostages and ends with a plea, "People of Israel: Do not neglect us."

title: Long Island man killed by girlfriend's jealous ex-husband remembered as 'hero' at funeral
content: Kenneth Pohlman, a 53-year-old Long Island resident and father of three, was laid to rest after being fatally shot while defending his girlfriend from her ex-husband in St. James. Mourners remembered him for his dedication as a father and sports enthusiast. Daniel Coppola, who had shown abusive behavior towards his ex-wife Kelly Coppola, has been arrested and confessed to the killings.
summary: Kenneth Pohlman, a 53-year-old Long Island resident and father of three, was laid to rest after being fatally shot while defending his girlfriend from her ex-husband in St. James. Mourners remembered him for his dedication as a father and sports enthusiast. Daniel Coppola, who had shown abusive behavior towards his ex-wife Kelly Coppola, has been arrested and confessed to the killings.

title: Who is Henry? World's oldest crocodile, who has fathered 10,000 babies with six partners
content: Henry, a massive Nile crocodile weighing 700 kg and measuring 16 feet, is now officially the world's oldest crocodile at age 123. Residing at Crocworld Conservation Centre in South Africa, he has fathered over 10,000 offspring. Captured in Botswana in 1903 for preying on children, Henry's life is now far removed from his violent past.
summary: Henry, a massive Nile crocodile weighing 700 kg and measuring 16 feet, is now officially the world's oldest crocodile at age 123. Residing at Crocworld Conservation Centre in South Africa, he has fathered over 10,000 offspring. Captured in Botswana in 1903 for preying on children, Henry's life is now far removed from his violent past.
